titleStmt.title: M54, 1 of 11. [Anon: The printing press brought the past into existence.]. Typescript fragment, 2 fols.
titleStmt.author: Virginia Woolf

publicationStmt.authority: The Estate of Virginia Woolf, administered by the Society of Authors

msIdentifier.repository: Henry W. and Albert A. Berg Collection of English and American Literature

physDesc.p: M54, 1 of 11. [The printing press brought the past into existence.]. Typescript fragment, 2 fols.

N.B.: This is one of eleven sub-fragments identified the Berg Collection's M54. [Anon: The printing press brought the past into existence...]. Typescript fragments, unsigned and undated, 35 fols. I have determined pagination and sequencing based on subject matter. M54 as curated by the Berg Collection is available as part of 'The Digital Anon' and can be found at [LINK].

handNote.p: Holograph writing by the documents' main hand, Virginia Woolf

correction.p: Apparent errors have been explicitly corrected in sic / corr tags, wrapped in a choice element.

interpretation.p: Names and references to places and literary works have been wrapped in rs tags which link to annotations and secondary material.

projectDesc.p: Text encoded as part of 'The Digital "Anon": A Digital Genetic Edition of Virginia Woolf's Final Essays'. This project, funded by Leverhulme Grant ECF-2022-602, seeks to construct a TEI-XML based digital edition of the drafts of 'Anon' and 'The Reader', among the final documents Woolf wrote before her death.

div.p: The printing press brought the past into existence. It brought into existence the man who is conscious of the pat (past) the man who sees his time, zzzzz against a back ground of the past; the man who firsts sees himself and shows himself to us. xmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmmm The first blow has been aimed at when the authors name is attached to the book. The indivi al (individual) emerges. His name is ; his mae (name) is also . Harrison emerging from the past tells us that he has a library; that he owns a mastiff; that he digs up Roman coins. He tells us that he has nev (never) ben (been) more than forty miles from in . Anon is losing his ambiguity. The present is becoming visible. Harrison sees the pxmxmxmxmsx the present agains (against) the settled reroded (recorded) past. The past looks degnerate (degenerate), raw, against that past.

Upstairs in the great room , as he tells us, "our ancient ladies of the court" were to be found reading the Greeks and the Latins. as they sat at their needlework. And the sch;ars (scholars) in the c ege (college) library were reading the classics that were chained to the shlves (shelves) in the college libraries. He turned away from the actors who even while he dug up voins (coins) in his garden were acting their crude darams (dramas) in the market place. Hxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxm atxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxxmmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmx wexmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmmxx Yet in spite of the printed book and the new learning, the the common people were still at their lewd practises.
